Instruction: Heat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Preheat a 10-inch cast iron skillet with butter in the oven.
Beat eggs at high speed with an electric mixer in a large bowl. Gradually add milk and flour, then pour the batter into the hot skillet.
Bake the batter in the hot skillet until puffy like a souffle, approximately 20 minutes. Once out of the oven, it will deflate. Sprinkle lightly with confectioners' sugar before serving.
